file_content.text: You want something?
Nothing more I can say to you.
So, Chemish brought you in, eh? Too bad we didn't get to train together--I like teaching the new recruits.
I'm Pyther. I'm one of the old hands, from before the Eagle started his whole galaxy-wide campaign. Back when we just had Gray Star.
What are the duties of an "old hand" around here?
What do you do?
I show the new guys how to put together a bomb without getting killed. You can learn a lot about a person that way.
Of course, a lot of times what you learn is that they're pretty much doomed. Not their fault, but... these new guys are fodder.
What's the story with Gray Star and the Eagle?
Tell me about your leaders.
The story? Look, the Eagle trained here. They say he was one of Gray Star's lieutenants before he took off and started finding allies.
Me? I appreciate what the Eagle's done. Killing Darth Jadus, blowing up the Dominator--that took guts. But Gray Star's the guy I follow.
What made you get involved with the resistance?
How'd you join up?
When the Republic fled Balmorra and let the Imperials take over, mom and dad got killed.
I'll never forgive the Empire for what they did to this planet--or the Republic, either, for leaving us to rot.
Without Gray Star, I wouldn't have much hope for Balmorra. But he knows what he's doing. He can make a weapon out of a farm boy. He'll get us out.
Gray Star could be the one to save us all.
Agreed.
Good to hear.
Tell me what Gray Star's like.
Let's hear more about him.
Never met him, but I've seen his messages. He's not as charismatic as the Eagle, but he's smart. That's all I need in a leader.
You take care of yourself now--I need to get back to work.
You really believe violence will save you?
But we're hurting people.
We won't get our freedom back unless we fight for it. You know that.
Look, I've got to get back to work. Trying to clean the gunk out of some droid parts we salvaged. I'll see you around.
